content:
I'll soon be starting a new job at the University of Saarbrücken, and would welcome the opportunity of hiring at least one post-doctoral student with lean interests. Some details:

  • This is a standard "Research Assistant", with 4 hours/week of teaching/tutoring duties (which will include running a lean practice seminar).
  • Teaching can be done in English.
  • Priority will be given to researchers with mathematical interests overlapping mine: geometric group theory, complexity theory, and symbolic and holomorphic dynamical systems.
  • Positions are typically offered for 2 years, extendable once.
  • The salary follows the A13/E13 guidelines (about 50k€/yr, depends on many factors such as experience and family).

Please contact me directly (laurent.bartholdi@gmail.com) if you are interested, with all the usual documents (CV, main results, research project). There is no specific deadline, I will consider applications as the come in.
I think it's great to see a math post-doc announcement mentioning Lean expertise. I'm afraid the timing is not great but I hope you'll find someone anyway.
Yes this is wonderful to see -- I am training PhD students right now with no clear idea about where they're going next.
Hi, what is the start date? If it is in 2022, then I'm interested.
@Laurent Bartholdi :this:
I've accepted another offer, so @Laurent Bartholdi is looking for candidates again.
